div.head: Introduction
div.p: Proyecto Humboldt Digital (ProHD) is an international initiative for continuing education in the digital humanities, which is located in Havana (Casa Museo Alejandro de Humboldt) and Berlin (Berlin-Brandenburg Academy of Sciences and Humanities).

The project focuses on the study of Cuban scientific and literary culture of the 18th and 19th centuries, especially on the exploration of sources relevant to Alexander von Humboldt's research on Cuba during the period of 1800–1830.
The project started in 2019 and is scheduled for completion in 2023. It has been funded thanks to generous support from the Auswärtiges Amt, Fritz Thyssen Stiftung and Gerda Henkel Stiftung.

div.head: Editorial principles
div.p: The "Digital Dossier: Alexander von Humboldt and Cuba (1800–1830)" contains transcriptions of textual documents in manuscript and printed format, in four languages (English, French, German and Spanish). They all relate to Humboldt's trip to Cuba and the questions the Prussian scientist studied in the Essai politique sur l'île de Cuba. The textual sources of the editions published in the "Digital Dossier" stem from libraries and archives in Germany, Cuba and Poland. div.head: Technical Aspects
div.p: All the texts and the corresponding metadata published in the "Digital Dossier" have been encoded in XML format following the Text Encoding Initiative (P5) Guidelines. To facilitate the encoding task, the framework ediarum developed by TELOTA has been adapted resulting in ediarum.PROHD.edit.

The TEI markup captures metadata about the documents, such as the source, those responsible for the edition and, whenever possible, the authorship and other data related to the creation of the texts. Regarding the texts themselves, the following information is encoded: Pagination of the original source, headings and paragraphs, divisions and logical divisions of letters, changes in typography, authorial interventions such as strikethroughs or additions, uncertain readings, gaps, supplied words, etc. For more details on our TEI markup, it is recommended to consult the ediarum documentation available in German and Spanish.

This web application has been built with TEI Publisher (v. 7.0.0.) and eXistDB (v. 5.2.0.). An ODD called prohd.xml is used to style the editions and static pages and two templates called prohd.html and view-grid-prohd.html are used to build the graphical user interface with web components. A copy of the files that make up the web application is available at the project's Github repository. Both the web application and the facsimiles are hosted on servers of the Oficina del Historiador de la Ciudad de La Habana; the facsimiles use IIIF's API.

The development of the framework ediarum.PROHD.edit and of this web application has been carried out by Antonio Rojas Castro with the collaboration of Violeta López. Technical inquiries can be directed to antonio.rojas-castro [at] bbaw.de.
